items.title: Carousing
items.content: Spend time and money socializing. This can lead to new contacts, information, or complications. The cost depends on your lifestyle.
items.example: Attending noble parties, drinking at taverns, participating in festivals

items.title: Gambling
items.content: Risk money for the chance to win more. This typically involves Wisdom, Charisma, or Dexterity checks, depending on the game.
items.example: Playing cards in a tavern, betting on gladiatorial matches, dice games

items.title: Base Building
items.content: Establish a party base or guild headquarters where you can invest resources, recruit NPCs, and improve defenses. Serves as a hub for planning, trade, and future adventures.

items.title: Extended Social Roleplaying
items.content: Develop long-term relationships—friendly alliances or bitter rivalries—with recurring NPCs that impact the storyline. These relationships evolve as you repeatedly interact with the same characters.
